page.title: 04Ecology.Hoo area cont.
page.content: Many species of wild flowers grow along the verges,the most common being sheep's parsley,primroses,cowslips,dog roses & blackthorn.There are not many trees because the land is so productive agriculturally.Many elms have died from Dutch Elm disease,hedges have been grubbed out making the fields large and prairie-like. Footpaths are well signposted and in places cross farm crops, but they are not walked often enough to keep them "open".Conservation of these,and of wild flowers,are of interest to local groups and much is done to preserve them. In this area of East Anglia rainfall is light,often with a dry Spring,which brings many problems as the heavy soil compacts and caps.Water is sometimes rationed during the summer.
